alert.note: Alert for Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:23PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARIPOSA AND SOUTH CENTRAL TUOLUMNE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM PDT... At 722 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yosemite Valley moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. Localized heavy rainfall could lead to nuisance flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Localized heavy rainfall could lead to nuisance flooding. Locations impacted include... Yosemite Valley, Little Yosemite Valley Campground, Porcupine Flat Campground, May Lake High Sierra Camp, Camp 4 Campground, North Pines Campground, Snow Flat, Yosemite Glacier Point, Little Yosemite Valley Ranger Station, Yosemite Valley Vistor Center, Lower Pines Campground, Yosemite Creek Campground, and Upper Pines Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
